DOCUMENT 212
ELECTRONICALLY FILED
7/15/2025 12:49 PM
70-DR-2023-900051.01
CIRCUIT COURT OF
TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
AT ALEXANDER CITY
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR )
PLAINTIFF/RESPONDENT )
VS. ) CASE NO. DR-2023-900051.01
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND )
DEFENDANT/PETITIONER )
RESPONSE TO MOTHER’S OBJECTION TO FATHER’S MOTION FOR CONTEMPT
AND MOTION TO HOLD FATHER IN CONTEMPT
Comes now the Respondent/Father, Christopher Blaine McGregor, by and through his
attorney of record, Dianne James Davis, and files this his Response to Mother’s Objection to
Father’s Motion for Contempt and Motion to Hold Father in Contempt, and would state as
follows:
1. That Father’s Counsel only received notice that the Mother intended to “pick up AK
for her visitation” via email received at 10:59 am July 14, 2025.
2. That in Mother’s Exhibit “A”, a text between the Mother and Father, the Father
relayed that A.K. said “she’s not ready for that”. When the parents met for drop off of
B.M., the Mother did not get out of the car and make any attempt to speak of A.K.
even though, in the text, the Father stated “You are more than welcome to have a
conversation with AK during drop off today”.
3. The minor child, A.K., is in therapy and due to her past history with her Mother, as
this Court has heard in the past, is not ready to have a one on one relationship with
her.
4. That it is the Mother’s responsibility to attend the Sunday Dinners, take time to speak
to the minor child when she is able to attend the child’s events, and take time to speak
to the minor child at drop off in order to build trust in a relationship. That as the
minor child stated in her text in Exhibit “C” in the Father’s filing “She never got out
of the car and spoke with me yesterday, never congratulated me for doing good at
cheer camp, so what changed now? I don’t wanna call her because she’s not
DOCUMENT 212
gonna really listen to me, she’s basically gonna be talking to herself because any
time I tell her how I feel, she always makes it about her”. The Father believes the
Mother should be concerned about building a relationship with A.K. by listening to
her concerns and congratulating her on her accomplishments rather than asserting her
rights. In this same Text, the Father told A.K. “We are both proud of you” as he is
not attempting to alienate A.K. from her Mother.
5. That the Mother’s marriage was void as she married during the appeal of the divorce,
so it is unknown to the Father if there are actually step-siblings involved. The
Mother’s concern should be establishing a relationship with A.K. first before
attempting to cultivate a relationship with any possible step-siblings.
6. That the Father is making every possible attempt to keep the minor child, A.K. safe
and in a good place mentally.
WHEREFORE, the premises considered, the Father respectfully requests this Court to find that
he is NOT in contempt of this Court for withholding the minor child, A.K. from the Mother and any
further relief he is entitled.
Respectfully submitted on this the 15th day of July, 2025.
/s/Dianne James Davis
Dianne James Davis (DAV007)
Attorney for Plaintiff/Father
107 Main Street
Alexander City, Alabama 35010
(256) 392-3172
(256) 392-3578 (Facsimile)
dianne@diannedavislaw.com
Certificate of Service
I hereby certify that I have served a copy of the foregoing upon the following via
electronic filing in the AlaCourt E-File System and/or by placing a copy of same, properly
addressed and postage paid in the U.S. Mail on this the 15th day of July, 2025.
Barbara H. Agricola
127 South 8th Street
Opelika, AL 36801
/s/Dianne James Davis
Of Counsel
